strings.app.title: AutoHotPie
strings.app.subtitle: Automation pies without AutoHotkey
strings.header.title: Pie Menu Studio
strings.localization.switcher.label: Language
strings.dashboard.welcomeBody.p1: This is the placeholder UI shell for the AutoHotPie Tauri application. Phase 1 tasks will flesh out the Tailwind token system, React state containers, and routing needed to render the pie menu designer, contextual profile editor, and settings surfaces inspired by
strings.dashboard.previewBody: Press {hotkey} to toggle a preview of the pie menu. Once contextual routing is connected, the preview will reflect the active profile and slice configuration.
strings.dashboard.previewEmpty: Add actions to your first profile to preview the menu.
strings.dashboard.contextualBody: Active profile will be selected automatically based on context rules. When available, we will display the active profile info here.
strings.profilesDashboard.sectionDescription: Manage pie menu presets, activation rules, and global hotkeys for each workflow.
strings.profilesDashboard.emptyBody: Create your first automation profile to start designing pie menus, assign hotkeys, and organize actions for different contexts.
strings.hotkeyPanel.title: Hotkey registration
strings.hotkeyPanel.description: Configure a global accelerator for the pie menu. Conflicts will surface a retry dialog with override options.
strings.hotkeyPanel.conflictDescription: Resolve the conflicts below in the Profiles dashboard before re-registering this shortcut.
strings.profileEditor.createPlaceholder.label: Profile Editor
strings.profileEditor.createPlaceholder.title: Create Automation Profile
strings.profileEditor.createPlaceholder.descript: Define profile metadata, assign a global hotkey, and scaffold the root pie menu. Backend persistence will hook into this surface once profile commands are available.
Start by giving the profile a name and optional description. You can set a global hotkey for quick activation and choose whether the profile is enabled by default.
Once created, you will be able to add menus and slices, attach actions, and nest child pie menus to build complex hierarchies.
strings.profileEditor.selectPlaceholder.title: Select a profile to begin editing
strings.profileEditor.selectPlaceholder.body: Choose a profile from the dashboard to explore its menus, slices, and nested pie structure.
strings.profileEditor.headerDescription: Navigate nested pie menus, manage slices, and preview the menu structure with contextual breadcrumbs.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeyErrorValidation: Resolve hotkey validation issues before saving.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeyErrorStructure: Fix menu validation errors before saving hotkey changes.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeySaveBlocked: Profile save blocked by validation errors. Review alerts below.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeySavedConflicts: Hotkey saved but requires conflict resolution.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeyClearFailed: Unable to clear hotkey while validation errors persist.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeyStructureWarning: Resolve menu validation issues (slice counts or nesting depth) before saving hotkey changes.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeyTip1: • Prefer combinations like Ctrl+Alt+Key or Cmd+Option+Key.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeyTip2: • Keep profile hotkeys unique to avoid conflicts.
strings.profileEditor.hotkeyTip3: • Leave empty to disable the hotkey for this profile.
strings.profileEditor.conflictsDescription: Resolve the issues below before re-registering this shortcut:
strings.profileEditor.validationDepth: Menu depth {depth} exceeds maximum {maxDepth}. Remove nesting or flatten menus.
strings.profileEditor.validationSliceMax: This menu has {count} slices. Reduce to {max} or fewer to avoid runtime errors.
strings.profileEditor.validationSliceMin: This menu has {count} slice{count === 1 ? '' : 's'}. Add {missing} more to reach the minimum of {min}.
strings.profileEditor.slicesEmpty: This menu has no slices yet.
strings.profileEditor.sliceDetailsEmpty: Select a slice to view details and navigate nested menus.
strings.contextPanel.title: Context conditions
strings.contextPanel.description: Define where this profile is considered active. All rules must pass for activation unless the fallback rule is used.
strings.contextPanel.emptyState: No context rules configured. Add one to restrict activation to specific apps or regions.
strings.contextPanel.mode.always.label: Always active
strings.contextPanel.mode.processName.label: Process name
strings.contextPanel.mode.processName.hint: Matches executable names like notepad.exe or code.exe.
strings.contextPanel.mode.windowTitle.label: Window title
strings.contextPanel.mode.windowTitle.hint: Matches window captions and document titles.
strings.contextPanel.mode.windowClass.label: Window class
strings.contextPanel.mode.windowClass.hint: Advanced matching using OS window class names.
strings.contextPanel.mode.screenArea.label: Screen region
strings.contextPanel.mode.screenArea.hint: Activates within a specific rectangle (x/y + width/height).
strings.contextPanel.mode.custom.label: Custom (backend)
strings.contextPanel.noRuleSelected: Select a rule to edit its conditions.
strings.contextPanel.rulesConfigured: {count} rules configured. Order defines evaluation priority.
strings.menuBar.status.openMessage: Pie menu is visible. Use your pointer or close the overlay.
strings.menuBar.status.closedMessage: Use the menu bar toggle or hotkey to open the pie menu.
strings.menuBar.header.caption: macOS menu bar
strings.menuBar.header.title: Pie Menu Control
